Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to the Joint Primary Aircraft Training System (JPATS).  JPATS is a joint, United States Air Force led, acquisition program.  Principal JPATS mission is primary training for entry-level student pilots, associated instructor pilots, and primary/intermediate training for United States Navy Naval Flight Officers.  JPATS includes the T-6 Texan II, which is a stepped tandem seat, commercially derived aircraft powered by a single turboprop engine.  

The overall goal of modifications budgeted is to correct discrepancies and deficiencies discovered after the delivery of the aircraft and to commence upgrades to avionic systems for FAA compliance.  Efforts include modifications to address safety, reliability, maintainability, obsolescence, and Diminishing Manufacturing Source (DMSMS) requirements.  Modifications, particularly to avionics systems, may also be driven by new Cyber Security requirements.  

Current (FY 2017) Navy T-6 inventory is 294 aircraft (43 T-6A and 251 T-6B aircraft) with aircraft service life thru 2035.  The United States Navy received delivery of final production Aircraft in 2016. Navy JPATS inventory includes 34 Ground Based Trainer System (GBTS) units (7 T-6A and 27 T-6B representative systems).

Justification.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was increased as compared to PB18 submission to account for additional modifications driven by changes within Correction of Deficiencies Operational Safety Improvement Program (OSIP 011-04) as well as updated costs within Avionics Upgrades Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) compliance (OSIP 007-16).  As part of this effort to improve execution alignment, the United States Navy commencing in FY 2016 has assumed full spectrum acquisition efforts for certain modifications that will be specific to T-6B aircraft and corresponding cost and schedule updates have been incorporated into this submission.       

Funding in FY 2019 is required for the correction of deficiencies, procurement of avionics upgrade kits required for compliance with Federal Aviation Administration regulations, and to provide support for Joint Primary Aircraft Training System retrofits.

FY 2019 deficiency correction efforts include, Canopy Fracturing Initiation System - Ballistic (CFIS-B) retrofit, Auto Ignition Relay retrofit, ejection seat Safe Arm Handle, Flight Management System, and Onboard Oxygen Generator System modifications, non-recurring engineering, installation and associated support efforts. These efforts are required to maintain T-6 fleet aircraft safety, reliability and performance of T-6 aircraft for the training of entry-level student pilots, associated instructor pilots and primary/intermediate training for Naval Flight Officers.

Name.@footnote: 3.3) Other Support: Increases are a result of Navy assuming full spectrum of acquisition efforts for modifications that are specific to T-6B aircraft.  Navy specific efforts include Flight Management System and Safe Arm Handle.  Support also includes contracting support to be provided on reimbursable basis by Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division.
3.4) Training Equipment: Safe Arm Handle GBTS - Fiscal change from Safe Arm Handle GBTS Kits to GBTS to address simulator kits.

Name.val: 1.1.1) Canopy Fracturing Initiation System (CFIS) - Ballistic - Organic

Name.@footnote: 2.1.4) Flight Management System retrofit kit:  ECP affects T-6B Aircraft only. Increase in kit cost due to the inclusion of Audio Management Unit (AMU) and Audio Control Panel (ACP) hardware into the overall unit cost of the kit.

2.1.5) Flight Management System (T-6B GBTS):  Previous submission combined the costs of kits for retrofit and for Ground Based Training System (GBTS) in a single line. Because these kits have different unit costs, separate cost elements have been created to illustrate them.

2.1.6) Avionics Obsolescence: Shifted from FY 2019 to FY 2022 to improve alignment with Joint program schedules.  Funding request was adjusted thru Future Years Defense Program (FYDP). Modifications to the avionics will be required to upgrade the electronic flight instrument displays, Altitude and Heading Reference (AHRS) controller, Midair Collision Avoidance, Military Flight Operations Quality Assurance (MFOQA) and backup flight instruments and those avionic components associated with the affected aircraft systems to include associated software updates.
2.1.7) Onboard Oxygen Generating System:  Quantities within fiscal years have been adjusted to improve alignment with Joint program schedules.
Name.val: 2.1.7) Onboard Oxygen Generating System - Concentrator - Organic

Name.@footnote: 2.1.10) Safety System Compliance Retrofit: Shifted from FY 2019 to FY 2021 to improve alignment with Joint program schedules. Funding request was adjusted through Future Years Defense Program (FYDP).

2.1.11) System Safety Compliance GBTS: Previous submission combined the costs of kits for retrofit and for Ground Based Training System (GBTS) in a single line. Because these kits have different unit costs, separate cost elements have now been created to illustrate them.
2.1.13 and 2.1.14) Textron (formerly Beechcraft) will be purchasing the kits.  Delivery takes 4 months and then DynCorp International will be installing the kits.
2.2.1) Non-recurring Engineering (NRE): FY 2019 NRE was decreased compared to PB18 submission.

Installation Cost:  Safe Arm Handle installation cost growth associated with increase in effort required for the safe arm handle modification. Due to schedule the first install of Safe Arm Handle will be 2nd quarter of FY19.
Name.val: Beechcraft Defense Corp - Safe Arm Handle

Name.@footnote: Installation - Safety System Compliance installation schedule, grouped, to include both Retrofit and GBTS kits.
Name.val: Beechcraft Defense Corp - Safety Systems Compliance

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Mod:: Installation Name: Safety System Compliance
Contractor Field Modification:: Installation Name: Safe Arm Handle
Contractor Logistics Support:: Installation Name: Safe Arm Handle - GBTS

Description.val:
This Operational Safety Improvement Program (OSIP) funds correction of deficiencies discovered during test and evaluation or operational use to the entire airframe, its components and subassemblies, avionics, related Peculiar Support Equipment, and Ground Based Training Systems.  

This OSIP includes modifications to address safety, reliability, maintainability, obsolescence, and Diminishing Manufacturing Source (DMSMS) requirements.  Modifications, particularly to avionic systems, may also be driven by new Cyber Security requirements.   

Correction of Deficiencies Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) include:  Airframe Structural/Sub-systems; Rudder Pedal instrumented; Auto Ignition Relay; Flight Management System; Avionics Obsolescence; Onboard Oxygen Generating System; Avionics Hardware/Software Modifications; Safety System Compliance; Landing Gear Control Handle redesign; System Safety Avionics; Controlled Flight Into Terrain Prevention and Crash Survivable Cockpit Voice Recorder; and Safe Arm Handle.  

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Received final production aircraft delivery in FY 2016. Continue incorporation of Engineering Change Proposals.

ModificationType.val: Safety, Reliability, Increased Service Life, Improved Mission Capabilities

Name.@footnote: 2.6) Other Support:  Automated Dependent Surveillance Broadcast Out modifications that are specific to T-6B aircraft.  Support includes, contracting support to be provided on reimbursable basis by Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division.  Navy is also providing support to Joint program acquisition efforts for T-6A aircraft.
FY18 has been updated due to fact of life updates from our Joint Program office.

1.1.2) GBTS Kits (T-6A): Due to different unit costs for the aircraft retrofit and Ground Based Training System (GBTS) kits, a separate GBTS kit line was added to the P3A to price out costs individually. FY18 has been updated due to fact of life updates from our Joint Program office.

1.1.3) Aircraft Retrofit Kits (T-6B):  A total quantity of 249 retrofit kits are expected to be procured under this Operational Safety Improvement Program.  Quantity of 2 test articles installed under development efforts are expected to remain on aircraft for a total of 251 T-6B aircraft.  Fact of Life changes based on proposal received, FY20 price increase is due to large quantity decrease.

Installation T-6B:  T-6B Installation schedule, grouped, to include both T-6B Retrofit and GBTS kits.  Kits are being bought by Textron (formerly Beechcraft) but Dyncorp International will install kits.
Installation T-6A: T-6A Installation schedule, grouped, to include both T-6A Retrofit and GBTS kits. FY19 Contract option will be award early to keep kit delivery and install on schedule.
Name.val: Beechcraft Defense Corp -  Aircraft Retrofit Kits & GBTS - T-6A

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Mods:: Installation Name: Install Aircraft Retrofit Kits & GBTS - T-6A
Contractor Field Mods:: Installation Name: Install Aircraft Retrofit Kits & GBTS - T-6B

Description.val:
This Operational Safety Improvement Program (OSIP) funds upgrades to avionic systems necessary for compliance with Federal Aviation Administration 28 May 2010 release DoT/FAA, 14 CFR Part 91: Automated Dependent Surveillance Broadcast (ADS-B) Out performance requirements to support Air Traffic Control (ATC) service final rule. This mandate stipulates that all aircraft required to have unrestricted access to operate in Classes A, B, and C airspace, certain Class E airspace, and other specified airspace requiring ADS-B Out, must be in compliance with this regulation by January 1, 2020. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  System development efforts for this update commenced in FY 2015, with hardware development costs reflected in R-1 Line #90.  Non-recurring engineering and support efforts to for Engineering Change Proposal development and implementation commenced in FY 2016.
